critique: The document is an executive order from President Franklin D. Roosevelt directing the Postmaster General, Secretary of War, and Secretary of Commerce to cooperate to ensure the continuation of air mail service after the annulment of domestic air mail contracts. It emphasizes the public interest and the emergency situation created by the cancellation of the contracts. The order directs the Secretary of War to provide the Postmaster General with the necessary resources, including airplanes, landing fields, pilots, and other personnel and equipment, to maintain air mail service during the emergency.
